comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Anyone know exactly where Alderson Street was?  Possibly Surry Hills?

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: One can see the night soil lane, and how it would have been operated. Also there doesn't appear to be any greenery, except for that half dead tree in the middle of the pix.

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Found it, about 1/2 hour of searching. It was located at Redfern, on the eastern side of Redfern Park. It was located within the block surrounded by Elizabeth St, Kettle St, Walker St and Phillip St. Alderson Street ran north south, parallel to Elizabeth St. In that block was also Bilston St, which ran parallel and to the east of Alderson. The lane could very well be Bilston Street.

Housing Commission flats occupy the site.

It can be found in Gregorys reprint of their 1st edition Sydney Street Directory of 1934, which was reprinted in 2006, to celebrate their 70th edition.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8793648@N06] I confess I was a bit slow on the uptake as to how to interpret your comment. I initially thought you meant the white fences looked ripe to be vandalised by graffiti tagging! :) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/29029178@N03] Great work in locating the street as Redfern, [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] but LOL, to think we previously looked closely at a 1893 map that just so happens to have had Alderson Street as almost the central focus! - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/_zoomify/2008/D00663/a1367381.html

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: If this is the "Rear of Alderson Street",  it must be Billston Street (as by the map link above), looking south from near the junction with Kettle Street - maybe upstairs at the back of No.9 Alderson St.   The dunnies seem to correspond.
